Function Documentation

◆ am_devices_mb85rs1mt_blocking_read()

uint32_t am_devices_mb85rs1mt_blocking_read ( void *  pHandle,
uint8_t *  pui8RxBuffer,
uint32_t  ui32ReadAddress,
uint32_t  ui32NumBytes 
)

Reads the contents of the fram into a buffer.

Parameters
pHandle- Pointer to device handle
pui8RxBuffer- Buffer to store the received data from the flash
ui32ReadAddress- Address of desired data in external flash
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to read from external flash

This function reads the external flash at the provided address and stores the received data into the provided buffer location. This function will only store ui32NumBytes worth of data.

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_mb85rs1mt_blocking_write()

uint32_t am_devices_mb85rs1mt_blocking_write ( void *  pHandle,
uint8_t *  pui8TxBuffer,
uint32_t  ui32WriteAddress,
uint32_t  ui32NumBytes 
)

Programs the given range of flash addresses.

Parameters
pHandle- Pointer to device handle
pui8TxBuffer- Buffer to write the external flash data from
ui32WriteAddress- Address to write to in the external flash
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to write to the external flash

This function uses the data in the provided pui8TxBuffer and copies it to the external flash at the address given by ui32WriteAddress. It will copy exactly ui32NumBytes of data from the original pui8TxBuffer pointer. The user is responsible for ensuring that they do not overflow the target flash memory or underflow the pui8TxBuffer array

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_mb85rs1mt_command_send()

)

◆ am_devices_mb85rs1mt_init()

uint32_t am_devices_mb85rs1mt_init ( uint32_t  ui32Module,
am_devices_mb85rs1mt_config_t *  pDevConfig,
void **  ppHandle,
void **  ppIomHandle 
)

Initialize the mb85rs1mt driver.

Parameters
ui32Module- IOM Module#
pDevConfig- IOM device structure describing the target spiflash.
ppHandle
ppIomHandle
Note
This function should be called before any other am_devices_mb85rs1mt functions. It is used to set tell the other functions how to communicate with the external spiflash hardware.
Returns
Status.

uint32_t am_devices_mb85rs1mt_nonblocking_read ( void *  pHandle,
uint8_t *  pui8RxBuffer,
uint32_t  ui32ReadAddress,
uint32_t  ui32NumBytes,
am_hal_iom_callback_t  pfnCallback,
void *  pCallbackCtxt 
)

Reads the contents of the fram into a buffer.

Parameters
pHandle- Pointer to device handle
pui8RxBuffer- Buffer to store the received data from the flash
ui32ReadAddress- Address of desired data in external flash
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to read from external flash
pfnCallback- called when transfer complete
pCallbackCtxt- argument passed to callback

This function reads the external flash at the provided address and stores the received data into the provided buffer location. This function will only store ui32NumBytes worth of data.

Returns
32-bit status

The user is responsible for ensuring that they do not overflow the target flash memory or underflow the pui8TxBuffer array

◆ am_devices_mb85rs1mt_read_id()

uint32_t am_devices_mb85rs1mt_read_id ( void *  pHandle,
uint32_t *  pDeviceID 
)

Reads the ID of the external flash and returns the value.

Parameters
pHandle- Pointer to device handle
pDeviceID- Pointer to the return buffer for the Device ID.

This function reads the device ID register of the external flash, and returns the result as an 32-bit unsigned integer value.

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_mb85rs1mt_status_get()

uint32_t am_devices_mb85rs1mt_status_get ( void *  pHandle,
uint32_t *  pStatus 
)

Reads the current status of the external flash.

Parameters
pHandle- Pointer to device handle
pStatus- Device status written here

This function reads the status register of the external flash, and returns the result as an 8-bit unsigned integer value. The processor will block during the data transfer process, but will return as soon as the status register had been read.

Macro definitions for interpreting the contents of the status register are included in the header file.

Returns
8-bit status register contents

◆ am_devices_mb85rs1mt_term()

uint32_t am_devices_mb85rs1mt_term ( void *  pHandle)

De-Initialize the mb85rs1mt driver.

Parameters
pHandle- Pointer to device handle

This function reverses the initialization

Returns
Status.

am_hal_iom_config_t g_sIomMb85rs1mtCfg
Initial value:
=
{
.eInterfaceMode = AM_HAL_IOM_SPI_MODE,
.ui32ClockFreq = AM_HAL_IOM_1MHZ,
.eSpiMode = AM_HAL_IOM_SPI_MODE_0,
.ui32NBTxnBufLength = 0,
.pNBTxnBuf = NULL,
}
